      Calculates the index in the linear array of fields from a (row, col) pair.
      Returns:

    • isField

      public boolean isField(int index)
      Returns true if index is a valid index of a field on the board.
      Returns:
      true if 0 <= index < DIM*DIM

    • isField

      public boolean isField(int row, int col)
      Returns true of the (row,col) pair refers to a valid field on the board.
      Returns:
      true if 0 <= row < DIM && 0 <= col < DIM

    • getField

      Returns the content of the field i.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the mark on the field

      Returns true if the field i is empty.

      Returns:

      public boolean isEmptyField(int row, int col)

      col - the column of the field
      Returns:

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Tests if the whole board is full.
      Returns:
      true if all fields are occupied

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      Returns true if the game is over. The game is over when there is a winner or the whole board is full.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over

    • hasRow

      public boolean hasRow(Mark m)
      Checks whether there is a row which is full and only contains the mark m.
      Parameters:
      m - the Mark of interest
      Returns:
      true if there is a row controlled by m

    • hasColumn

      public boolean hasColumn(Mark m)
      Checks whether there is a column which is full and only contains the mark m.
      Parameters:
      m - the Mark of interest
      Returns:
      true if there is a column controlled by m

    • hasDiagonal

      public boolean hasDiagonal(Mark m)
      Checks whether there is a diagonal which is full and only contains the mark m.
      Parameters:
      m - the Mark of interest
      Returns:
      true if there is a diagonal controlled by m

    • isWinner

      public boolean isWinner(Mark m)
      Checks if the mark m has won. A mark wins if it controls at least one row, column or diagonal.
      Parameters:
      m - the mark of interest
      Returns:
      true if the mark has won

    • isDraw

      public boolean isDraw()
      Checks if there is a draw, so if both players won at the same time, or if the board is full.
      Returns:
      true if there is a draw, false if there isn't

    • hasWinner

      public boolean hasWinner()
      Returns true if the game has a winner. This is the case when one of the marks controls at least one row, column or diagonal.
      Returns:
      true if the student has a winner.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Empties all fields of this board (i.e., let them refer to the value Mark.EMPTY).

    • setField

      public void setField(int i, Mark m)
      Sets the content of field i to the mark m.
      Parameters:
      i - the field number (see NUMBERING)
      m - the mark to be placed

    • setField

      public void setField(int row, int col, Mark m)
      Sets the content of the field represented by the (row,col) pair to the mark m.
      Parameters:
      row - the field's row
      col - the field's column
      m - the mark to be placed

    • rotateBoard

      public void rotateBoard(int command)
      Rotates the selected quadrant of the board.

      literely trial-and-errored the shit out of this method, we first looked at what rotating a quadrant did to the index numbers, and wrote down how the every index in a quadrant chances if we rotated it clock and counter clockwise, then we discovered that the diference between the indexes of the quadrants can be calculated with a so called multFactor that looks at the relative position of the first index of a quadrant (the topleft cel) those are, in order, 0-3-18-21

      Parameters:
      command - is the quadrants number
